intro: Saurauia whitfordii, commonly known as the Whiteford's saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas, particularly in India and Nepal. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at elevations above 2,000 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
